definition: free from artificiality, (craps) a first roll of 7 or 11 that immediately wins the stake
details:
adjective
- free from artificiality
= synonyms: lifelike
- being talented through inherited qualities
= example: being talented through inherited qualities
= synonyms: born, innate
- related by blood
= synonyms: akin, blood-related, cognate, consanguine, consanguineous, consanguineal
- in accordance with nature
- existing in or produced by nature
- existing in or in conformity with nature or the observable world
= example: existing in or in conformity with nature or the observable world
- (of a musical note) being neither raised nor lowered by one chromatic semitone
= example: (of a musical note) being neither raised nor lowered by one chromatic semitone
- functioning or occurring in a normal way
- (used especially of commodities) being unprocessed or manufactured using only simple or minimal processes
= example: (used especially of commodities) being unprocessed or manufactured using only simple or minimal processes
= synonyms: raw, rude
- unthinking
= synonyms: instinctive
noun
- (craps) a first roll of 7 or 11 that immediately wins the stake
- a notation cancelling a previous sharp or flat
= synonyms: cancel
- someone regarded as certain to succeed
= example: someone regarded as certain to succeed
